title: Gideon66
author: Gideon66
content: If you are a newbie to the crypto world here are some tips that can help you get started: firstly learn the basics - understand the technology and how things work. - be ware of the risk involved . - secure a wallet . - start with something you can afford to lose .

comments.author: rachael9385

Are you already Bitcoin investor before joining this forum? Why I asked the question because with your post history I conclude that you are crypto newbie but not you are given same crypto newbies some Bitcoin tips (wow).However, it's good to have you in the forum, your tips are good, it will help many crypto newbies to be safe if they don't know a shit about Bitcoin.

comments.author: DaNNy001
comments.body: Quote from: Gideon66 on November 02, 2023, 09:10:42 PMIf you are a newbie to the crypto world here are some tips that can help you get started: firstly learn the basics - understand the technology and how things work. - be ware of the risk involved . - secure a wallet . - start with something you can afford to lose .Op, although your writing pattern looks like the one of a newbie trying to fish out merit, but I won't denied the fact that what you have stated is actually true and if every beginner should follow these tip during their journey in the crypto space pertaining Bitcoin investment, then I guess the rate at which they will experience loses will be at a minimal percent.So many newbie fail to actually evaluate the risk involvement on actually securing a good and safe Bitcoin Investment. Then the case of actually starting off with something you can afford to lose is simply the best option because so many people think that holding Bitcoin for investment is actually easy but the truth is that it's easier said than done because holding your coins requires alot discipline that won't involve you selling off during any dip in the Market.

comments.author: Makus
comments.body: Op its true what the other members are saying, your account was created on the 15th of last month and you are still a newbie, but here you are giving advise to other newbies, tho it's not bad to give quality advise but I suggest you learn more so as to improve you post quality with enough information for others to learn from, so you'll easily get the merit you desire to rank up and get attached to a signature campaign. Quote from: Gideon66 on November 02, 2023, 09:10:42 PM - start with something you can afford to lose .As an investor I am not satisfied with that statement, there is no such thing like money that we can afford to lose, except your money is not hard earned or you are a gambler who takes some stupid risk with very high expectations, every tiny bit of our currency is not worth loosing for any thing, even if you start with 5k naira, it could sub you for a whole 2weeks and that enough data to get you more knowledge about Bitcoin, you are not the first I have seen make this mistake, even some top ranked members in this forum also make the same mistake. Our people say 1+1 na two, any thing wey u fit add to that one wey you get go count as something added to the system.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: I think GiftedMAN created "Newbies Stop Teaching When You Need to Learn." Because of newbies like yourself. It's not bad to create a topic, but creating threads that are less meaningful is really not wise, or even a better way of phishing for merit, because it seems that's what your intentions are. You have been spamming, and the thing you get for spamming is to get on the ignor list of some members who you might have even earned merit from. If you read through your other threads, then you will see my advice; follow it, and you will be a better newbie. Let your enthusiasm be for positivity and not spamming around; be focused on learning.
